result.execSummary:
Charles R. MacArthur Jr. was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Charles R. MacArthur Jr. was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles R. MacArthur Jr.

defendant.name: MacArthur, Charles R., Jr.
defendant.address: 1402 E. Easterday Avenue, Sault Sainte Marie, MI 49783

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Charles R. MacArthur in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers.  Defendant Charles R. MacArthur in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Court reviews fugative complaint with defendant, inquires whether defendant will be fighting extradition. Atty Gerbers indicates he hasn't had time to talk to defendant since last hearing, explains options to defendant. Defendant wishes to waive extradition. Court reviews waiver, finds defendant is freely, voluntarily and competently waiving his right to extradition. Defendant signs order for waiver of extradition. Court executes order. Defendant will be returned to the State of Michigan to face charges there.

Defendant Charles R. MacArthur in court, in custody. Attorney Gregory A. Gerbers appeared by phone. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews fugitive complaint, questions Defense on whether Defendant is opposing Complaint or waiving extradition. Defense advises that they did not have time to discuss matter in detail. Court questions whether Defense will be here on Friday. Defense can be here on Friday. Defendant questions Court on what's going on. Court advises that he needs to speak with his attorney. Atty Gerbers can appear by phone Friday if he believes Defendant understands what's going on.  Extradition hearing scheduled for December 26, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
